title: Coronation Street's Emma fights for life as she's found unconscious after misdiagnosis
text:

Coronation Street favourite Emma Brooker is rushed to hospital next week after being discovered unconscious at home.

The character, who recently discovered she was Steve McDonald's daughter collapses after feeling unwell.

Doctor Ali Neeson is accused of negligence after advising Emma she has food poisoning, only for the emergency situation to be much more serious.

Emma is raced to hospital in an ambulance, before doctors reveal to her worried loved ones she needs an emergency operation as the truth about her condition comes to light.

(Image: ITV)

The character has a ruptured appendix and needs to have it removed, and her loved ones can do nothing but wait.

Steve, meanwhile, rages at Ali when he learns what he said to his daughter, blaming him for her hospital dash.

The scenes air next Friday during the double episode of the soap, when Emma heads home after experiencing pains in her side at work.

(Image: ITV)

Colleague Maria asks former flame Ali to check her over, but he's far too irritated to hear his ex has arranged a date with Gary Windass.

He tells Emma it is likely just food poisoning, not taking it seriously, before the worried hairdresser heads home to get some sleep.

It's shortly after that Maria and Gary head back to the flat and find Emma unconscious on the floor, not responding to them.

(Image: ITV)

After they call an ambulance, she's raced to hospital where the trio are met by her dad Steve.

As Emma heads in for emergency surgery, Steve makes the discovery about Ali and it's clear he's not prepared to forget it.

What will it mean for Ali, and will Emma be okay?

Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV.
description: Coronation Street airs worrying scenes as an unconscious Emma Brooker is rushed to hospital for emergency surgery
